org.conqat.lib.commons.color

Class MultiColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Color
      • org.conqat.lib.commons.color.MultiColor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Paint, java.awt.Transparency, java.io.Serializable

    public class MultiColor
extends java.awt.Color
    A multicolor manages an ordered color distribution, i.e. provides a list of colors with a count for these colors. Colors may be contained more than once. To be compatible with code that expects "plain" colors, we inherit from color and require a primary/dominant color to be determined for such code.

    This class is designed to be immutable.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiColor

        public MultiColor(java.awt.Color primaryColor,
                  PairList<java.awt.Color,java.lang.Integer> colorDistribution)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        primaryColor - the primary color passed to code that does not support multi colors.
        colorDistribution - the color distribution. All entries must have a positive integer and the list may not be empty.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of colors in the distribution. This corresponds to the number of (color, int) pairs and does not necessarily count distinct colors.
